gobblin.yarn

Class GobblinYarnAppLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.yarn.GobblinYarnAppLauncher

  • public class GobblinYarnAppLauncher
extends Object
    A client driver to launch Gobblin as a Yarn application.

    This class, upon starting, will check if there's a Yarn application that it has previously submitted and it is able to reconnect to. More specifically, it checks if an application with the same application name exists and can be reconnected to, i.e., if the application has not completed yet. If so, it simply starts monitoring that application.

    On the other hand, if there's no such a reconnectable Yarn application, This class will launch a new Yarn application and start the GobblinApplicationMaster. It also persists the new application ID so it is able to reconnect to the Yarn application if it is restarted for some reason. Once the application is launched, this class starts to monitor the application by periodically polling the status of the application through a ListeningExecutorService.

    If a shutdown signal is received, it sends a Helix Message.MessageType.SCHEDULER_MSG to the GobblinApplicationMaster asking it to shutdown and release all the allocated containers. It also sends an email notification for the shutdown if GobblinYarnConfigurationKeys.EMAIL_NOTIFICATION_ON_SHUTDOWN_KEY is true.

    This class has a scheduled task to get the ApplicationReport of the Yarn application periodically. Since it may fail to get the ApplicationReport due to reason such as the Yarn cluster is down for maintenance, it keeps track of the count of consecutive failures to get the ApplicationReport. If this count exceeds the maximum number allowed, it will initiate a shutdown.
